item.title: Bang & Olufsen MMC Cartridge Protector: Dimensionally True Reproduction with Stereolithography
item.description:
I recently decided to test out the clear resin (sometimes referred to as “maker juice”) on my Formlabs Form 1 printer. I chose to design a replica of a Multi Media Card (MMC) cartridge protector, as they always seem to go missing. While I own multiple MMC cartridges, I only had one remaining protector. As you can see in the images, the finished product is pretty good! The term “transparent” might be subjective, as the 3D-printed clear material doesn’t quite match the real thing...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/bang-olufsen-mmc-cartridge-protector-dimensionally-true-reproduction-with-stereolithography/

item.title: Beocord 5000 (4715/4716): Polishing of Plexiglass Panel
item.description:
I’m working on restoring another Beocord 5000 (4715/4716) cassette deck, inspired by the resurgence of cassette tapes. It reminds me of the days when creating mixtapes was a way to express affection, unlike simply sharing Spotify playlists today. I decided to practice polishing a spare Beocord 5000 panel before working on the one for my restoration project. I was concerned about the coating on these plexiglass panels, but it seems like it was only there to enhance shine without affecting the color...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beocord-5000-47154716-polishing-of-plexiglass-panel/
